Key Match Events: India beat Ireland by 2 runs via DLS method
Jasprit Bumrah made a terrific comeback after getting hit for a boundary on the first ball as he clean bowled Andrew Balbirnie for four
Ravi Bishnoi has provided Team India with a massive breakthrough as he dismissed Paul Stirling for 11
Prasidh Krishna joins the party and removes Harry Tector for nine
Arshdeep Singh provides Team India with a massive breakthrough as he dismissed Curtis Campher for 39
Barry McCarthy scored 51 not out off 33 balls
Pre-Game Insights: India skipper Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and opted to bowl against Ireland in the first T20I on Friday

Jasprit Bumrah said at the toss 'We'll bowl first, very happy to be here. The weather looks lovely. I feel good, looking forward to play some cricket. You realise what you were missing, very happy to be back. We expect nothing short of a fight from Ireland. As a fast bowler, I hope the pitch does something. We have two debuts - Rinku and Prasidh Krishna. Told them to just enjoy their cricket.'

Paul Stirling said at the toss 'Looking forward to going out there. We have had a good run in Scotland, let's see what we can show today. This is the beginning of the road to 2024 and the World Cup. We're bringing Craig Young in today, excited to see what the extra pacer can do on this track.'
Post-Match Reflections: India beat Ireland by 2 runs via DLS method to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series in Dublin on Friday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rain eventually wins the battle as the game has been called off
The surface is known for pace, bounce and high scoring. Nice covering of grass on this pitch, it will seam around given the overcast conditions.
Others: Rinku Singh and Prasidh Krishna received their caps from captain Jasprit Bumrah
